page.title: 04HOUSING IN THE AREA
page.content: On the Northern edge of Ashdown Forest, small groups of houses grew up near the gates - Coleman's Hatch, Chuck Hatch, forester's and keeper's lodges and charcoal burner's huts. On lower and more fertile ground several large farms were established, particularly around Marsh Green where Newbridge Mill Forge was built. Ironmasters'houses,in the 17th Century, were farms as well and after the iron industry ceased little new building took place before the late 19th century, when smaller housing for farm workers and artisans was built, mainly along the B2110 road. In 1910 much land was sold by the Buckhurst Estate and areas around Cotchford and Parrock Lane were developed with large houses. Between the wars some 'ribbon' development took place along the B2110.
